- - *This article is about the material. For the items, see [gem](/wiki/Gem "Gem").*
  - *For the material that non-gem "crystal" objects in NetHack are made of, see [glass](/wiki/Glass "Glass").*

**Gemstone** is a [material](/wiki/Material "Material") that appears in *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Description](#Description)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 GruntHack](#GruntHack)
  - [2.3 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.4 xNetHack](#xNetHack)
  - [2.5 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.6 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)

- [3 References](#References)

## Description

All [gems](/wiki/Gem "Gem") that are not worthless pieces of glass - which appear as 'gems' until identified - are made out of gemstone. [Rings](/wiki/Ring "Ring") with the following [randomized appearances](/wiki/Randomized_appearance "Randomized appearance") are made of gemstone:

- Agate
- Black onyx
- Diamond
- Emerald
- Jade
- Moonstone
- Ruby
- Sapphire
- Tiger eye
- Topaz

[Polypiling](/wiki/Polypiling "Polypiling") gemstone objects may result in either a [stone golem](/wiki/Stone_golem "Stone golem") or a [clay golem](/wiki/Clay_golem "Clay golem").[\[1\]](#cite_note-1)

## Variants

In variants with an [object materials](/wiki/Object_materials "Object materials") system, many more objects including weapons and armor can be made of gemstone, sometimes referred to as **crystal**. It is generally a high-quality material for weapons and armor, but such items are very expensive and often hard to come by.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces [new types of golem](/wiki/Golem_\(SLASH%27EM\) "Golem (SLASH'EM)") that are made of gemstone - the ruby, sapphire, diamond, and crystal golems. All gemstone golems have a powerful physical attack and a breath weapon; the diamond golem can used a random breath attack, similar to the [Chromatic Dragon](/wiki/Chromatic_Dragon "Chromatic Dragon"). All four varieties of golem drop gems of their respective material upon death, with the crystal golem leaving behind a pile of random valuable gems.

### GruntHack

In [GruntHack](/wiki/GruntHack "GruntHack"), gemstone is the heaviest and most expensive among object materials, but provides a +2 bonus to AC relative to iron armor and is immune to [erosion](/wiki/Erosion "Erosion").

### dNetHack

In [dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack"), gemstone is an available material for objects - new items that are made of gemstone include the [fossil dark](/index.php?title=Fossil_dark\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Fossil dark (page does not exist)") and [magicite](/index.php?title=Magicite\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Magicite (page does not exist)"). Items made of gemstone have a submaterial for a specific type of gem, rather than being made of an unspecified generic gemstone.

Valuable gems can also be used as focusing crystals for [lightsabers](/wiki/Lightsaber "Lightsaber") to produce different-colored 'blades'; worthless pieces of glass will always result in a red lightsaber.

### xNetHack

In [xNetHack](/wiki/XNetHack "XNetHack"), gemstone provides a +2 AC bonus for armor similar to GruntHack, but is much lighter in comparison to most metals save for [mithril](/wiki/Mithril "Mithril").

Wands with the randomized appearance of "hexagonal" are now made of quartz.

### EvilHack

In [EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack"), gemstone functions similarly to xNetHack in terms of armor and AC. Gemstone weapons additionally gain a +3 damage bonus if they deal slashing or piercing damage; [dwarven-made weapons](/wiki/Dwarvish_items "Dwarvish items") have a 1⁄20 chance of generating as made of gemstone.

The following items have a base material of gemstone:

- [Sunsword](/wiki/Sunsword "Sunsword") (crystal)
- [The Sword of Kas](/wiki/The_Sword_of_Kas "The Sword of Kas")
- [Crystal plate mail](/wiki/Crystal_plate_mail "Crystal plate mail")
- [Rods](/wiki/Rod "Rod")
- [Crystal chests](/wiki/Crystal_chest "Crystal chest")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM changes, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds two randomized appearances for amulets, "tetraedical" and "isocaedical", that are composed of gemstone; both appearances are associated with the [amulet of second chance](/wiki/Amulet_of_second_chance "Amulet of second chance") and [amulet of data storage](/wiki/Amulet_of_data_storage "Amulet of data storage") (respectively) in the code by default.

## References
